title: Sri Lankans in Lebanon urged to remain vigilant and exercise caution
byline: Sri Lankans in Lebanon have been urged to remain vigilant and exercise caution due to the prevailing war-like situation between Iran and Israel.

title: Mega Power lottery creates history with Rs.474 mn winner
byline: The largest lottery prize in Sri Lanka’s history was won yesterday (16).

title: Showers above 50mm expected in several areas
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (17), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Donald Trump urges Tehran evacuation as Iran-Israel conflict enters fifth day
byline: Israel and Iran attacked each other for a fifth straight day on Tuesday, and U.S. President Donald Trump urged Iranians to evacuate Tehran, citing what he said was the country’s rejection of a deal to curb nuclear weapons development.

title: Sri Lankans in Lebanon urged to remain vigilant and exercise caution
byline: Sri Lankans in Lebanon have been urged to remain vigilant and exercise caution due to the prevailing war-like situation between Iran and Israel.

title: Mega Power lottery creates history with Rs.474 mn winner
byline: The largest lottery prize in Sri Lanka’s history was won yesterday (16).

title: Showers above 50mm expected in several areas
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (17), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Donald Trump urges Tehran evacuation as Iran-Israel conflict enters fifth day
byline: Israel and Iran attacked each other for a fifth straight day on Tuesday, and U.S. President Donald Trump urged Iranians to evacuate Tehran, citing what he said was the country’s rejection of a deal to curb nuclear weapons development.

title: Several Opposition MPs walk out of Parliament
byline: Several opposition members of Parliament have walked out of the Parliament chamber today in protest over the actions of the Speaker of House, according to Chief Opposition Whip MP Gayantha Karunathilake.

title: No fuel shortage in Sri Lanka, Energy Ministry asserts
byline: The Minister of Energy has urged the general public not to be misled by ‘fake news’ about a purported fuel shortage.

title: Israel-Iran conflict takes centre-stage in Sri Lanka’s Parliament
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa today questioned as to what steps have been taken by the government to lessen the impact the Israel-Iran conflict may have on Sri Lankans and local businesses.

title: IMF First Deputy Managing Director calls on PM Harini in Colombo
byline: Visiting First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund Dr. Gita Gopinath has called on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya in Colombo.

title: Leaders of opposition parties hold special meeting
byline: Leaders of several parties in the opposition have convened a special meeting in the Parliament complex.

title: Over 2,000 LG election candidates fail to submit income and expenditure reports - EC
byline: A total of 2,433 candidates, political parties, and independent groups who contested the Local Government (LG) election have failed to submit their income and expenditure reports, the Election Commission has stated.

title: Neurosurgeon and clerk at J’pura Hospital arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: A specialist neurosurgeon and a clerk attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: President arrives in Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament, a short while ago.

title: G7 leaders urge Trump to ease off trade war
byline: World leaders at the Group of Seven summit in Canada on Monday (Jun 16) pushed US President Donald Trump to back away from his punishing trade war, arguing that it poses a risk to global economic stability.

title: Social media now main source of news in US, research suggests
byline: Social media and video networks have become the main source of news in the US, overtaking traditional TV channels and news websites, research suggests.

title: Trains along coastal line delayed
byline: Train services along the coastal line are experiencing delays due to damages to the railway track, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Parliamentary session commences
byline: The Parliamentary session commenced at 9:30 a.m. today (June 17).

title: 2023 Titan Sub Implosion: New details revealed in Netflix documentary
byline: Netflix viewers have been left disturbed by a moment in the 2023 documentary about the Titan submarine blast.

title: Train guards threaten to launch 48-hour strike
byline: Railway guards have declared a 48-hour strike from midnight on Friday (20) in protest over delays in implementing key railway reforms.

title: Former maid at ex-Minister Keheliya’s residence granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of a former domestic worker at a residence of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, who was arrested and remanded in connection with an ongoing investigation into the alleged inclusion of 15 individuals on his personal staff...

title: Issuance of bus tickets will be made mandatory – Transport Minister
byline: The issuance of travel tickets to bus passengers will be made mandatory, says Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayaka.

title: Sri Lanka-France sign debt restructuring agreement
byline: The signing of the bilateral agreement between Sri Lanka and France in relation to the external debt restructuring process is a significant milestone of the external debt restructuring process, the Ministry of Finance stated.

title: SL Embassy to assist in obtaining re-entry visas for Sri Lankans to enter Israel
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Israel has decided to assist in obtaining re-entry visas for Sri Lankans who are hoping to enter the country.

title: Air India flight from Ahmedabad to London suspended due to technical issue
byline: Air India flight from Ahmedabad to London was suspended on Tuesday (June 17) due to a technical issue, said sources.

title: IMF to evaluate Sri Lanka’s fourth review on July 01 - Dr. Gopinath
byline: The International Monetary Fund’s Executive Board is scheduled to evaluate Sri Lanka’s fourth review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) on July 01, IMF’s First Deputy Managing Director Dr. Gita Gopinath said during an exclusive interview with Ada Derana.

title: Sri Lanka moves to end pensions and entitlements for ex-Presidents and MPs
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to draft legislation aimed at repealing the Presidents’ Entitlements Act No. 4 of 1986 and the Parliamentary Pensions Law No. 1 of 1977, effectively ending special privileges extended to former Presidents, their families, and retired Members of Parliament.

title: Hearing of case filed against Chamara Sampath postponed to November
byline: The hearing of the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption against Badulla District Member of Parliament Chamara Sampath Dassanayake for allegedly causing a loss of over Rs. 17.6 million to the government, before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court has been postponed.

title: Sri Lanka focuses on developing a unique Food Security Index
byline: The government is currently prioritizing the development of a country-specific Food Security Index, with the goal of completing the initiative within the next three months, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Chaos at Seethawaka PS over election of new Chairman
byline: The election of the new Chairman and the Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha has been postponed indefinitely over disagreement pertaining to the voting method.

title: 2029 O/L Exam will be held under new curriculum - PM Harini
byline: The 2029 G.C.E. Ordinary Level examination will be held under the new curriculum, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has confirmed.

title: Public urged not to be misled by claims of fuel shortages
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has urged the public not to be misled by social media posts claiming an impending fuel shortage in the country due to the ongoing Iran-Israel conflict.

title: Former Deputy GM of Land Reclamation Corp arrested
byline: A former Deputy General Manager of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation (SLLRDC) has been arrested by officers of the Bribery Commission.

title: President chairs meeting of Ministerial Consultative Committee on Defence
byline: The Ministerial Consultative Committee on Defence met today (17) in Parliament under the Chairmanship of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is also the Minister of Defence.

title: Sri Lanka to establish Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to proceed with the preparation of a draft bill aimed at establishing an independent Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIBSL) in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lankan Embassy in Iran shifted to safer location - FM
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Iran has been moved from its current location today in the wake of the continuous attacks on Tehran, Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath told the Parliament.

title: Govt. to introduce special fixed deposit scheme for elderly citizens
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has green-lighted the implementation of the proposed special fixed deposit scheme for senior citizens.

title: “Childcare is not solely a women’s issue” – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasised that childcare is not solely a women’s issue as it is an economic and policy issue. She said that enabling women to balance work and caregiving is not only the right thing to do, but also essential for economic progress.

title: Trump says US knows where Iran’s Supreme Leader is hiding, urges Iran’s unconditional surrender
byline: President Donald Trump said Tuesday the U.S. knows where Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is hiding during the Israel-Iran conflict but doesn’t want him killed “for now.”

title: Special notice to Sri Lankans seeking employment in Israel
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Ministry says that the Population and Immigration Authority (PIBA) of Israel has informed that Israel’s international airports are currently not operating at full capacity due to the current situation between Israel and Iran.
